CL_DEVICE_BUILT_IN_KERNELS: Built-in kernels supported by the device
CL_DEVICE_GLOBAL_MEM_CACHE_SIZE: Size of global memory cache (in bytes)
CL_DEVICE_GLOBAL_MEM_CACHELINE_SIZE: Size of global memory cache line (in bytes)
CL_DEVICE_GLOBAL_MEM_SIZE: Size of global device memory (in bytes)
CL_DEVICE_HOST_UNIFIED_MEMORY: Device and the host have a unified memory subsystem
CL_DEVICE_IMAGE_MAX_BUFFER_SIZE: Max number of pixels for a 1D image created from a buffer object
CL_DEVICE_IMAGE_MAX_ARRAY_SIZE: Max number of images in a 1D or 2D image array
CL_DEVICE_IMAGE_PITCH_ALIGNMENT: The row pitch alignment size in pixels for 2D images created from a buffer
CL_DEVICE_IMAGE_BASE_ADDRESS_ALIGNMENT: The minimum alignment in pixels of the 'host_ptr' specified to 'clCreateBuffer'
CL_DEVICE_LOCAL_MEM_SIZE: Size of local memory arena (in bytes)
CL_DEVICE_MAX_COMPUTE_UNITS: The number of parallel compute cores
CL_DEVICE_MAX_CONSTANT_ARGS: Max number of __constant arguments in a kernel
CL_DEVICE_MAX_CONSTANT_BUFFER_SIZE: Max size of a constant buffer allocation (in bytes)
CL_DEVICE_MAX_MEM_ALLOC_SIZE: Max size of memory object allocation (in bytes)
CL_DEVICE_MAX_PARAMETER_SIZE: Max size of kernel arguments (in bytes)
CL_DEVICE_MAX_READ_IMAGE_ARGS: Max number of simultaneously read image objects
CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_GROUP_SIZE: Maximum number of work-items in a work-group
CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_ITEM_DIMENSIONS: Maximum dimensions that specify work-item IDs
CL_DEVICE_MAX_WORK_ITEM_SIZES: Maximum number of work-items in each dimension
CL_DEVICE_MAX_WRITE_IMAGE_ARGS: Max number of simultaneously written image objects
CL_DEVICE_MEM_BASE_ADDR_ALIGN: Alignment of the base address (in bits)
CL_DEVICE_MIN_DATA_TYPE_ALIGN_SIZE: Minimum alignment for any data type (in bytes)
CL_DEVICE_NATIVE_VECTOR_WIDTH_CHAR: The native ISA vector width for char type
CL_DEVICE_NATIVE_VECTOR_WIDTH_SHORT: The native ISA vector width for short type
CL_DEVICE_NATIVE_VECTOR_WIDTH_INT: The native ISA vector width for int type
CL_DEVICE_NATIVE_VECTOR_WIDTH_LONG: The native ISA vector width for long type
CL_DEVICE_NATIVE_VECTOR_WIDTH_FLOAT: The native ISA vector width for float type
CL_DEVICE_NATIVE_VECTOR_WIDTH_DOUBLE: The native ISA vector width for double type
CL_DEVICE_NATIVE_VECTOR_WIDTH_HALF: The native ISA vector width for half type
CL_DEVICE_OPENCL_C_VERSION: The highest fully backwards compatible OpenCL C version supported by the compiler for the device
CL_DEVICE_PARTITION_MAX_SUB_DEVICES: The maximum number of sub-devices that can be created when a device is partitioned
CL_DEVICE_PARTITION_PROPERTIES: The list of partition types supported by device
CL_DEVICE_PARTITION_AFFINITY_DOMAIN: The list of supported affinity domains for partitioning the device
CL_DEVICE_PARTITION_TYPE: The properties argument specified in 'clCreateSubDevices' if device is a sub-device
CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_INTEROP_USER_SYNC: The devices preference is for the user to be responsible for synchronization, when sharing memory objects between OpenCL and other APIs such as DirectX
CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_CHAR: Preferred native vector width size for char type
CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_SHORT: Preferred native vector width size for short type
CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_INT: Preferred native vector width size for int type
CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_LONG: Preferred native vector width size for long type
CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_FLOAT: Preferred native vector width size for float type
CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_DOUBLE: Preferred native vector width size for double type
CL_DEVICE_PREFERRED_VECTOR_WIDTH_HALF: Preferred native vector width size for half type
CL_DEVICE_PRINTF_BUFFER_SIZE: Maximum size in bytes of the internal buffer that holds the output of printf calls from a kernel
CL_FP_ROUND_TO_NEAREST: Round to nearest even rounding mode supported
CL_FP_ROUND_TO_ZERO: Round to zero rounding mode supported
CL_FP_ROUND_TO_INF: Round to +ve and -ve infinity rounding modes supported
CL_EXEC_KERNEL: The OpenCL device can execute OpenCL kernels
CL_EXEC_NATIVE_KERNEL: The OpenCL device can execute native kernels
CL_QUEUE_PROFILING_ENABLE: The profiling of commands is enabled
